summary: Nvidia (NVDA) stock traded flat Monday as market turmoil pressured shares of chipmakers . Stocks recovered from earlier losses late Monday morning to trade down slightly . Moody's lowered the US credit rating, raising concerns over the country's fiscal stability .  Nvidia announced it will allow its customers to build semi-custom AI servers with other companies’ AI chips . Bank of America analyst Vivek Arya reiterated his Buy rating on the stock following the announcement .  Nvidia is set to release its quarterly earnings results on May 28 . Qualcomm shares fell less than 1% Monday . The chipmaker has said it plans to launch its own CPUs that can pair with Nvidia’s AI chips .

Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI) fell slightly, S&P 500 (^GSPC) dropped 0.1%, Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) sank 0.2% after both indexes saw greater losses in early trading . Moody's cut the US government’s long-term credit rating from AAA to AA1 late Friday, citing escalating deficits and the increasing burden of refinancing US debt .  Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says tariffs will return to facing "Liberation Day" hikes if they don't negotiate deals "in good faith" during 90-day pause . He added that the US is focused on striking deals with 18 "important" trading partners . This week’s calendar is light on scheduled economic announcements, and the market is monitoring manufacturing data .  Shares of Apple (AAPL) and Alibaba (BABA) were down on Monday following a New York Timesreportstating that the Trump administration is concerned about a deal between the two companies that would make the Chinese company's artificial intelligence available on iPhones in China . On Monday, both Apple and Baba stock dropped roughly 2% amid an overall market retreat .  Stocks fell on Monday, with Tech and Consumer Discretionary leading to the downside . The Dow Jones Industrial Average (^DJI)fell about0.6% . The S&P 500 dropped more than 1% on the day .  Moody's cut the US government’s long-term credit rating from Aaa to Aa1 late Friday . The Nasdaq Composite (^IXIC) sank 1.5% on the heels of afive-day run of wins . Investors may also be reacting to Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent's remarks .  Novavax (NVAX) stock shot up more than 16% premarket on Monday after the company received FDA approval for its COVID-19 vaccine . Palantir shares slid 4% an hour before the opening bell .  Moody's became the last of the major ratings agencies to downgrade US credit . The move stoked concerns around the growing $36 trillion US deficit, seen by some as alooming debt time-bomb . Shares in Nvidia dropped around 3% in the wake of the news from the Computex Taipei tech expo in Taiwan .  Moody's Ratings downgrade reignited worries about whether US assets are still popular at a time of lingering global trade uncertainty . S&P 500 futures (ES=F) slid 1.2% on Monday following the debt downgrade, which Moody's said was in response to a ballooning budget deficit that showed little sign of narrowing .  Shares of Walmart slipped in premarket trading after President Trump took the retailer to task over its looming tariff-fueled price hikes . His Treasury Secretary, Scott Bessent, meanwhile played down concerns about a tariff boost to inflation by saying Walmart's price-hike warning was a "worst-case scenario"  China's National Bureau of Statistics reported April industrial output rose 6.1% year-over-year, slowing from 7.7% in March but beating forecasts . Retail sales climbed 5.1%, below the expected 5.5% and down from March’s 5.9% . Markets across the region responded negatively as Hong Kong's Hang Seng (^HSI) dropped 0.5%, while China's CSI 300 (000821.SS) lost 0 .5% .

Intel's Arc Pro B50 and B60 cards are designed for workstation workstations . They're designed for customers who don't necessarily need or want to use cloud-based AI processors from the likes of Amazon and Google . Workstation systems provide strong security since data is processed on-site rather than being sent to the cloud .  Intel's Arc Pro B50 is a mainstream chip designed for AI-assisted software engineering . The B50 has 16GB of memory and support for up to 170 TOPS, or trillions of operations per second . According to the company, entry workstation GPUs make up about 30% of the workstation market .  Intel's Project Battlematrix workstation system combines two to eight Arc Pro B60 GPUs with an Intel Xeon processor . Nvidia's DGX Station provides up to 784GB of memory for AI applications . The DGX Spark is a pint-sized supercomputer that runs on Nvidia's Grace Blackwell GB10 superchip .  Nvidia still has to prove it can hang in the larger, more lucrative hyperscaler market . The B60 and B60 may not be as powerful as Nvidia's offerings, but they're clear indications that Nvidia is dedicated to gaining ground in the AI workstation market .

The Zacks Earnings ESP aims to find earnings surprises by focusing on the most recent analyst revisions . The core of the ESP model is comparing the Most Accurate Estimate to the Zacks Consensus Estimate, where the resulting percentage difference between the two equals the Expected Surprise Prediction .  Nvidia's Earnings ESP sits at 3.87%, which is calculated by taking the percentage difference between its Most Accurate Estimate and the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $0.92 a share . Texas Instruments is a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold) stock, and is getting ready to report earnings on July 22, 2025 .  NVIDIA Corporation (NVDA) and Texas Instruments Incorporated (TXN) are reporting for profitable earnings season trading . Use the Zacks Earnings ESP Filter to turn up stocks with the highest probability of positively, or negatively, surprising to buy or sell before they're reported .

The rapid expansion of artificial intelligence infrastructure in the Middle East marks a “watershed moment” for U.S. tech companies, says Wedbush analyst Dan Ives . Saudi Arabia has committed to purchasing 18,000 Nvidia chips for a 500-megawatt data center being built by Humain . The UAE has received support from President Trump to build “the largest AI data center outside the US” in Abu Dhabi .  Saudi Arabia, the UAE, and Qatar are now on the “priority list” for U.S. tech, says Wedbush . Regional demand for AI chips, software, robotics, and data centers expected to surge over the next decade . “No Nvidia chips for China... red carpet rollout for the Kingdom,” firm wrote .  List ahead of earnings ahead of U.S. list ahead of the fourth quarter . List includes companies like Apple, Microsoft, Sony, Sony and Sony .

Goldman Sachs strategist David Kostin says Apple (AAPL), Alphabet (GOOGL), Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) and Amazon are trading at their lowest collectivevaluation since 2018 . The group's next-twelve-month price-to-earnings ratio stands at about 28x on aggregate, versus roughly 20x for the broader S&P 493 .  Recent reports of Apple's plans for an AI-driven search feature sent Alphabet's shares down by about 7%, highlighting the margin for disruption within the elite seven .

U.S. stock futures are pointing lower as investors digest Moody's credit rating downgrade . Walmart shares are falling in premarket trading after President Donald Trump says the company should "eat" tariffs on China . Nvidia (NVDA) and Foxconn say they will build an AI factory supercomputer in Taiwan .  Moody's downgrade places the U.S. government one rung below Moody's Aaa status . The rating cut comes as Congress considers a budget that would extend significant tax cuts and boost spending . President Donald Trump wrote in a social media post that Walmart should absorb tariffs .  Chipmaking giant Nvidia and partner Foxconn announce they will build an AI factory in Taiwan . U.S.-listed shares of Diageo slip 1% in premarket trading after it expects a $150 million hit from tariffs .  The U.S. recently announced a trade deal with the U.K. that would reduce some tariffs on products from that country but would keep in place a 10% baseline tariff . The deal would cut costs by $500 million over the next three years .

NVIDIA has unveiled its RTX PRO™ Servers as part of a strategic effort to accelerate the transition of enterprise IT infrastructure to AI factories . Major companies are opting for these AI factories to power complex applications in sectors like electronics manufacturing, healthcare, and robotics, reflecting a significant move towards AI-driven operations .  NVIDIA's focus on Blackwell architecture and AI model scaling could significantly boost growth in data center and AI markets . On Monday, AMD's stockholders approved increasing its authorized shares of common stock from 2.25 billion to 4.0 billion . Mizuho has lifted price targets for several AI server-related stocks . The brokerage raised its target for AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) to $135 from $117, for Dell Technologies to $145 from $140 . The broker believes that Broadcom stands to benefit from “strong ramps for Custom Silicon ASICs” into 2026 .  Nvidia's near-term earnings may be mixed due to the H20 phase-out and slower Blackwell ramp . Tailwinds from President Trump’s Middle East visit were also flagged by Mizuho . Despite no price target change for Broadcom, firm reiterated its Outperform rating and $250 price target .  Dell, SMCI and SMCI all saw price targets hiked thanks to strong AI server pipeline and expected PC refresh cycle . Mizuho also reiterated its Outperform rating on Credo, citing strong hyperscaler engagement and growth potential in data center interconnect solutions .

In recent years, stocks in the artificial intelligence field have become known for achieving sky-high valuations . Many AI stocks appear to be undervalued . That creates a possible opportunity in companies that investors may have overlooked, increasing the odds that you can generate outsized returns .  Google parent Alphabet is selling at a P/E ratio of 19 . The company is an AI pioneer, first applying the technology in 2001 . It generated $75 billion in free cash flow over the last 12 months and holding $95 billion in liquidity .  AMD may be one of the more surprising stocks to be overlooked . It is arguably the most prominent CPU maker, pulling ahead of longtime leaderIntel . Even though it lags Nvidia in the AI accelerator market, it looks increasingly like a rising player in that industry .  DeepSeek is one of two AI tech companies that faces headwinds from negative sentiment . The company's forward P/E ratio of 13 indicates its profit growth will continue . Qualcomm is another AI stock that trades at just 16 times earnings, and the stock price should continue .  Qualcomm's chipset business was the primary reason its revenue in the second quarter of fiscal 2025 (ended March 30) rose 17% annually to $11 billion . Qualcomm has made strides in its Internet of Things and automotive businesses .  The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years . Netflix wasn’t one of them . Stock Advisor’s total average return is975% — a market-crushing outperformance compared to172% for the S&P 500 .  The Motley Fool has a short of short May 2025 $30 calls on Intel . Intel is one of three AI-related tech companies that have a long-term outlook for the future .

Nvidia and Foxconn are working with the Taiwanese government to build an AI factory in Taiwan . Foxconn will provide the AI infrastructure via its subsidiary, Big Innovation Company, acting as an NVIDIA Cloud Partner . The factory will house 10,000 NVIDIA Blackwell GPUs, which is expected to enhance availability of AI computing .  The Big Innovation Cloud AI factory will be equipped with NVIDIA Blackwell Ultra systems . Foxconn plans to leverage the system to enhance automation and efficiency within its three main focus areas: smart cities, electric vehicles, and manufacturing .  ABCI-Q is claimed to be the world's largest research supercomputer dedicated to quantum computing . The system features 2,020 NVIDIA H100 GPUs interconnected by the NVIDIA Quantum-2 InfiniBand networking platform . According to Nvidia, it is a step towards practical, accelerated quantum systems .  ABCI-Q integrates a superconducting qubit processor by Fujitsu, a neutral atom quantum processor by QuEra, and a photonic processor by OptQC . These allow hybrid quantum-GPU workloads across various qubit modalities .  The information on this site has been included in good faith for general informational purposes only . We give no representation, warranty or guarantee as to its accuracy or completeness .

Nvidia and Foxconn said they will build an AI factory supercomputer in Taiwan . Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSM) will use the AI system the two create to advance its research and development . Last month, Nvidia said it planned tobuild AI supercomputers entirely in the U.S.

On May 19, JFrog Ltd. (NASDAQ:FROG) announced its integration with NVIDIA Enterprise AI Factory, establishing itself as the cornerstone software artifact repository for AI-powered applications . This collaboration enhances scalable, secure deployment using the NVIDIA Blackwell platform .  FROG has 100x upside potential and is more promising than FROG . If you are looking for an AI stock that's more promising, check out our report about thecheapest AI stock .

Nvidia unveiled Isaac GR00T-Dreams, a blueprint that helps generate large amounts of synthetic motion data that can be used to teach robots new behaviours . Nvidia shares were down 2.5% in pre-market trading on Monday, though the stock has seen a stronger performance more recently .  Hong Kong-listed shares in Alibaba fell 3% on Monday following a report over the weekend that the Trump administration had raised concerns about a potential deal between Alibaba and Apple . The report further weighed on Alibaba shares, which dropped last week after the company's earnings missed estimates .  Shares in biotechnology company Novavax (NVAX) surged 17% in pre-market trading on Monday . The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved its Covid-19 vaccine . The vaccine was approved for people aged 65 and over, and those aged 12 and over if they had at least one underlying condition that put them at high risk of severe illness from Covid .  Ryanair posted revenue of €13.44bn (£11.31bn), up 4% on the previous year . Profit after tax of €1.6bn was down 16% . Further headwinds for Ryanair are the problems at Boeing .  Diageo posted a 2.9% increase in net sales to $4.4bn and reiterated its guidance for the full-year . The drinks maker said it was launching a $500m cost savings programme over three years .  Mould said that Diageo seemed "remarkably calm about tariffs" despite guidance of a $150m impact . Mould added that Diageso has a big job to win back the market’s favour after a difficult few years .  forAppleandAndroid.com users will be able to download the latest iPhone and Android versions of this article this week's featured articles on Apple and Android editions.com .

Qualcomm announced Monday it will develop custom data center CPUs designed to link with Nvidia’s AI chips . While Nvidia dominates the AI accelerator space, its chips require CPUs—traditionally supplied by Intel and AMD . Qualcomm initially pursued an Arm-based server chip in the 2010s and tested it with Meta Platforms .  Qualcomm’s push into data center CPUs gained momentum with its 2021 acquisition of Nuvia, a company that develops Arm-based processor designs . The data center CPU space is fiercely competitive, with major cloud providers like Amazon and Microsoft deploying their own custom-built processors, alongside established industry giants AMD and Intel .  Qualcomm says it will build custom data center CPUs that link with Nvidia chips . This on-device approach could enable faster AI performance and improved privacy, as sensitive data remains local to the hardware .

Artificial intelligence (AI) stocks have surged in recent years as the AI boom picked up speed . Investors eagerly piled into these players with the hope that AI would become the next game-changing technology . Stanley Druckenmiller sold Nvidia as it continued to soar and expressed regret about the decision .  Last year, Duquesne Family office head sold all of his shares of AI chip leader Nvidia . Now, in the first quarter of this year, Druckenmiller has made another bold move concerning a market-beating AI stock that's soared 1,500% .  Long-term investing offers us plenty of time to score a very satisfactory win . In the first quarter of this year, the billionaire sold all of his shares ofPalantir Technologies .  Druckenmiller bought Palantir stock in the first quarter of last year, so he held on to it for about a year . Last year, the shares surged 340%, then continued to march higher, advancing more than 70% from the start of this year through today .  It's important to remember that Druckenmiller is a professional and has the time and resources to quickly enter and exit positions . But smaller non-professional investors may find that by staying invested in a particular player -- such as Nvidia or Palantir -- they might score an additional win .  The Motley Fool Stock Advisoranalyst team just identified what they believe are the10 best stocksfor investors to buy now . The 10 stocks that made the cut could produce monster returns in the coming years . Hold on to these players for a number of years also could be a great move .  Billionaire Stanley Druckenmiller Dumped Nvidia last year . Now he just sold all of his shares of a market-beating AI stock that's soared 1,500% over the past 3 years .

By now, it's clear that artificial intelligence (AI) is the next major technology platform . Big tech companies are pouring tens of billions of dollars into data centers to run the computing power required for AI . Nvidia dominates market share of data center GPUs .  Nvidia has delivered monster returns for early investors, but plenty of investors are wondering if the company's stock is still a good buy . In 2012, Apple was the most valuable company in the world, riding high from the recent launch of the iPhone and the iPad . Investors seemed unable to envision the dramatic future growth of Apple's services business .  At the time, Apple was trading at a discount to theS&P 500, which was valued at a P/E of 15.9 . While Apple's market cap has risen about six times, or 500%, the growth in the stock price has been nearly 1,000% due to share buybacks .  Nvidia stock trades at a P/E of 45 and a forward P /E of just 31.5 . That compares to a 25.7 P/e ratio for the S&P 500 and a 20.5 forward . Nvidia might not become a ten-bagger like Apple was in 2012, but just like investors were underestimating the growth of mobile technology .  Nvidia is likely to be a big winner over the next five to 10 years . Apple, Netflix and Netflix are among the companies that are about to pop . If you invested $1,000 in 2009, you’d have $351,127!  Missed out on Apple in 2012? Buying Nvidia stock today could be your second chance . The Motley Fool recommends Apple, Nvidia, and Walmart .
Hewlett-Packard Enterprise (HPE) said Monday it expanded its AI portfolio in collaboration with NVID . NVID is a partner with HP Enterprise .

Form 13Fs provide investors with a snapshot of what Wall Street's leading money managers are buying and selling . Appaloosa's David Tepper sold another 380,001 shares of Nvidia in the March-ended quarter .  A 13F allows everyday investors to track which stocks Wall Street's leading money managers bought and sold in the most recent quarter . Appaloosa Management's David Tepper, who oversees north of $8.3 billion in AUM, has an exceptional investing acumen of his own .  During the first quarter, more than half of Appaloosa's fund's shares of artificial intelligence (AI) darlingNvidia(NASDAQ: NVDA) were sold . Tepper disposed of 380,001 shares of Nvidia in first quarter -- 56% sequential quarterly reduction .  Competition is picking up in a big way for Nvidia . AMD and Huawei are developing next-generation AI-GPUs of their own for sale in high-compute data centers . Nvidia can lose out on future data center real estate to these internally developed chips .  Nvidia's Hopper (H100) chip was commanding north of $40,000 in early 2024, compared to $10,000 to $15,000 per chip for AMD's Instinct series chips . As competition has manifested in the AI arena, Nvidia's gross margin has declined in each quarter since peaking a year ago .  Appaloosa's 13F depicts more selling than buying activity during the March-ended quarter . David Tepper did pick out more than a half-dozen new stocks to add to his fund . If an AI bubble were to form and burst, Broadcom wouldn't be immune .  Broadcom is one of the leading providers of wireless chips and accessories used in smartphones . The expansion of 5G wireless networks leads to relatively steady demand for Broadcom's chips . Broadcom has its fingers in a number of other key industries that would help partially insulate it in the event of an AI bubble .  First-quarter weakness in Broadcom's stock opened the door for David Tepper to potentially scoop up shares at roughly 23 times forward-year earnings in March . Nvidia:if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2009,you’d have $351,127!* Apple: If you invested  in Apple in 2008, you'd have $40,106!* Netflix: If . you invested in Netflix in 2004, you would have $642,582! Right now, we’re issuing “Double Down” alerts for three incredible companies .  There may not be another chance like this anytime soon . Billionaire David Tepper sold 56% of Appaloosa's stake in Nvidia and is loading up on this AI Titan .

Nvidia's CEO Jensen Huang is visiting Taipei this week for the annual Computex trade show . Huang was born in Tainan before migrating to the U.S. when he was nine . His every move has been watched since his private jet touched down on Friday afternoon .  Huang's fame in Taiwan prompts bafflement from Nvidia colleagues and concern from his bodyguards . Some Taiwanese media termed the expression "Jensanity" to describe the level of devotion he generates when he visits . Nvidia has set up a pop-up store selling playing cards, shirts and other memorabilia with Huang's image .  Huang was a guest of honour at the opening ceremony of the World Masters Games in Taiwan . He was also at the event alongside Olympic gold medalist boxer Lin Yu-ting and renowned Taiwanese actor and director Sylvia Chang . His participation briefly embroiled Taiwan's presidential office after criticism from opposition politicians that Vice President Hsiao Bi-khim was only making a last-minute appearance to "freeload" on Huang also being there .  Taiwan's transport ministry said it would be T$95,562 ($3,167) assuming he was staying for six days . The number reported in the media of more than T$60,000 is wrong, it said . The aircraft, operated by executive aircraft charter operator VistaJet, left Taipei on Saturday afternoon to fly to Honolulu .

Nvidia's graphics processors, or GPUs, dominate the market for training AI models . New cloud players called "neoclouds" have emerged to specialize in renting out Nvidia's chips to software developers . New tool called Lepton lets cloud computing companies sell GPU capacity in one spot .  Lepton will eventually allow developers to search for Nvidia chips located in specific countries to meet data storage requirements . It will also allow companies that already own some Nvidia chips to more seamlessly search for more to rent .  Nvidia did not disclose what the business model will be for the new software platform . Bjorlin said developers will still retain their own relationship to the underlying compute providers, so they've contracted directly with them .

Qualcomm will make custom data center central processing units that use technology from Nvidia . Nvidia's chips are dominant in the AI market but always paired with CPUs . Nvidia has jumped into the CPU market itself, designing a chip using technology from Arm Holdings . Qualcomm last week confirmed that it has a letter of understanding with Saudi Arabia .  Qualcomm says its future chips will use technology from Nvidia that will help them communicate quickly with Nvidia's graphics processors (GPUs) The company says it is advancing a vision of high-performance energy-efficient computing to the data center .

AIST’s ABCI-Q Supercomputer Equips Researchers to Realize the Potential of Quantum Computing . Quantum processors promise to augment AI supercomputers in solving some of the world's most complex challenges, spanning industries including healthcare, energy and finance .  ABCI-Q’s AI supercomputing is integrated with a superconducting qubit processor by Fujitsu, a neutral atom quantum processor by QuEra and a photonic processor byOptQC .  The NVIDIA accelerated computing platform in ABCI-Q will empower scientists to experiment with the stepping-stone systems needed to advance quantum computing . NVIDIA DGX Cloud Lepton is an AI platform with a compute marketplace that connects the world’s developers building agentic and physical AI applications with tens of thousands of GPUs . CoreWeave, Crusoe, Firmus, Foxconn, GMI Cloud, Lambda, Nebius, Nscale, Softbank Corp. and Yotta Data Services will offer NVIDIA Blackwell and other NVIDIA architecture . Developers can tap into GPU compute capacity in specific regions for both on-demand and long-term computing .  DGX Cloud Lepton unifies access to cloud AI services and GPU capacity across the NVIDIA compute ecosystem . The platform integrates with the NVIDIA software stack to accelerate and simplify the development and deployment of AI applications .  Developers can purchase GPU capacity directly from participating cloud providers through the marketplace or bring their own compute clusters . The platform offers a unified experience across development, training and inference, helping boost productivity .  NVIDIA Exemplar Clouds will help NCPs enhance security, usability, performance and resiliency . Yotta Data Services is the first NCP in the Asia-Pacific region to join the initiative . Developers can sign up for early access to NVIDIA DGX Cloud Lepton . NVIDIA Isaac GR00T N1.5 is the first update to NVIDIA’s open, generalized, fully customizable foundation model for humanoid reasoning and skills . Agility Robotics, Boston Dynamics, Foxconn, Lightwheel, NEura Robotics and XPENG Robotics are among many robot makers adopting NVIDIA Isaac™ .  NVIDIA Isaac GR00T-Dreams is a blueprint that helps generate vast amounts of synthetic motion data — aka neural trajectories — that can be used to teach robots new behaviors . Developers can first post-train Cosmos Predictworld foundation models(WFMs) for their robot . Then, using a single image as the input, GR00Ts generates videos of the robot performing new tasks in new environments .  The GR00T-Dreams blueprint complements theIsaac GR00t-Mimic blueprint, which was released at the NVIDIA GTC conference in March . GR00TN1.5 can better adapt to new environments and workspace configurations, as well as recognize objects through user instructions .  N models include AeiRobot, Foxlink, Lightwheel and NEura Robotics . NVIDIA Cosmos Reason is a new WFM that uses chain-of-thought reasoning to help curate data curate .  Cosmos Predict 2, used in GR00T-Dreams, is coming soon to Hugging Face, featuring performance enhancements for high-quality world generation and reduced hallucination . NVIDIA Isaac Sim™ 5.0, a simulation and synthetic data generation framework, will soon be openlyavailable on GitHub .  Robotics, Boston Dynamics, Fourier, Mentee Robotics, NEura Robotics and XPENG Robotics are simulating and training their humanoid robots using NVIDIA Isaac Sim and Isaac Lab. pipelines . Skild AI is using the simulation frameworks to develop general robot intelligence .  NVIDIA Jetson Thor platform, coming soon, enables accelerated on-robot inference and runtime performance . GB200 NVL72 — available with NVIDIA DGX™ Cloudon leading cloud providers and NVIDIA Cloud Partners— to achieve up to 18x greater performance for data processing . Global IT Providers Offer Products, Software and Services to Accelerate Full-Stack AI Platform Shift With NVIDIA Blackwell NVIDIA RTX PRO Server . Built withNVIDIA RTX PRO 6000 Blackwell Server Edition GPUs, RTX PRO Servers extend the leading performance and energy efficiency of the NVIDIA Blackwellarchitecture .  NVIDIA Blackwell architecture enables enterprises to unlock the full potential of AI in their data center infrastructure . Cadence, Foxconn and Lilly are among the first planning to build AI factories using the NVIDIA Enterprise AI Factory validated design with RTX PRO Servers .  Foxconn is building an AI factory to advance global semiconductor and electronics manufacturing with NVIDIA-accelerated IT infrastructure . Foxconn says it is harnessing the performance of NVIDIA Blackwell to build AI infrastructure that will transform electronics manufacturing .  Enterprises can accelerate AI and data science workloads on RTX PRO Servers with the NVIDIA AI Enterprisesoftware platform . Developers can optimize AI inference performance and agent accuracy with NVIDIA NIM™ andNeMo™ microservices .  The full-stack, validated design provides AI software stack recommendations to help enterprise customers build and operate on-premises AI factories . NVIDIA ecosystem partners are building products, software and services to speed the enterprise IT shift to accelerated AI factory infrastructure .  Blackwell AI factories are ideal for accelerating workloads across a broad range of popular enterprise software platforms, including those from Ansys, Cadence, CrowdStrike, Elastic, Red Hat, Siemens and Synopsys . Enterprises building AI factories with NVIDIA RTX PRO 6000 Blackwell GPUs can deploy NVIDIA-Certified Storage .  NVIDIA's enterprise AI factory with RTX PRO Servers . Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) is a leading fabless designer of chips used in gaming, PCs, data centers, automotive, and a variety of end markets . Nvidia’s sales grew at an incredible 64.2% compounded annual growth rate over the last five years . Long-term investors should be prepared for periods of high growth .  Analyzing the long-term change in earnings per share (EPS) shows whether a company's incremental sales were profitable . Nvidia’s EPS grew at an astounding 83.3% compounded annual growth rate over the last five years . This tells us the company became more profitable on a per-share basis as it expanded .  Nvidia's free cash flow margin was among the best in the semiconductor sector, averaging 45.9% over the last two years . With the recent decline, the stock trades at 31× forward P/E (or $132.10 per share) Is now a good time to buy? See for yourself in our full research report, it’s free .  ServiceNow (+178% between March 2020 and March 2025) as well as once-small-cap company Exlservice (+354% five-year return) that made our list in 2020 include now familiar names such as ServiceNow .

NVIDIA DGX Spark, DGX Station Personal Systems for AI Developers, Researchers and Data Scientists . Acer, Asus, Dell Technologies, GIGABYTE, HP, Lenovo and MSI build the systems . Enterprises, software providers, government agencies, startups and startups need robust systems that can deliver the performance and capabilities of an AI server in a desktop form factor .  Powered by the NVIDIA Grace Blackwell platform, DGX Spark and DGX Station will enable developers to prototype, fine-tune and inference models from the desktop to the data center .  DGX Station features the NVIDIA GB300 Grace Blackwell Ultra Desktop Superchip, which offers up to 20 petaflops of AI performance . The system can serve as an individual desktop for one user running advanced AI models using local data, or as an on-demand, centralized compute node for multiple users .  Both systems use the NVIDIA DGX operating system, preconfigured with the latest NVIDIA AI software stack . Developers can use common tools, such as PyTorch, Jupyter and Ollama, to prototype, fine-tune and perform inference .  The DGX Spark will be available from Acer, Asus, Dell Technologies, GIGABYTE, HP, Lenovo and MSI . Dell Pro Max with GB10 and Dell ProMax with NVIDIA GB300 give organizations infrastructure to integrate and tackle large AI workloads .  DGX Station is expected to be available from ASUS, Dell Technologies, GIGABYTE, HP and MSI later this year . Watch theCOMPUTEXkeynote from Huang and learn more at NVIDIA GTC Taipei . The Big Innovation Company supercomputer will provide AI cloud computing resources to the Taiwan technology ecosystem . The plan is to create an AI-focused industrial ecosystem in southern Taiwan, the National Science and Technology Council said . “Our ultimate goal is to . create a smart AI island filled with smart cities, and we look at the future of AI-driven innovation,” said Minister Wu Cheng-Wen .  Foxconn Drives Regional Technology Innovation as NVIDIA Cloud Partner . Foxconn will use the AI supercomputer of Big Innovation Company to build a factory . NVIDIA partnering with Foxconn and Taiwan to help build Taiwan's AI infrastructure, and to support TSMC and other leading companies to advance innovation in the age of AI and robotics . CoreWeave shares soared last week after the AI cloud provider posted a surge in quarterly revenue and disclosed that Nvidia has a higher stake in the company than investors had anticipated . The measuring principle projects an upside target in the shares of $96.90, about 20% above Friday's closing price .  CoreWeave shares have more than doubled from their IPO price, boosted by last week’s news and investor appetite for up-and-coming AI plays . The company also said last week that it had agreed to a four-year deal withChatGPTmaker OpenAI worth up to $4 billion, adding to a nearly $12 billion commitment announced in March .  Investors can project a potential upside price target by using the themeasuring principle, a technique that analyzes priorprice action to forecast future moves . The first lower level on the chart to monitor sits around $73.90 . Investors looking forretracemententry opportunities may place buylimit orders near Thursday’s high .  Pullback in CoreWeave shares could see the price revisit key lower support around $57 . This area would likely attract buying interest near the cup and handle’s top trendline .

Nvidia in advanced talks to invest in quantum computing startup PsiQuantum, report says . Nvidia plans to sell a technology that will tie chips together to speed up the chip-to-chip communication needed to build and deploy artificial intelligence tools . Marvell Technology and MediaTek plan to adopt the NVLink tech called Fusion for their custom chip efforts . Other partners include Alchip, Fujitsu and Qualcomm .  Nvidia has grown beyond its roots as a video game graphics chip maker into the dominant producer of the chips that have powered the AI frenzy . Huang disclosed the company's plan to build a Taiwan headquarters in the northern suburbs of Taipei .  Computex is the first major gathering of computer and chip executives in Asia since U.S. President Donald Trump threatened to impose tariffs . Nvidia's dominance in the AI chip market and robust software moat has made it a darling of the stock market . Amazon's AWS cloud computing platform, complete AI stack, and effective data-driven advertising platform are key growth catalysts . Both companies are trading at valuation levels significantly lower than their historical averages .  Semiconductor giant Nvidia has 92% share in the $125 billion data center GPU market . Nvidia's recently launched Blackwell architecture chips are already showing strong momentum . Blackwell systems are optimized for inferencing (real-time deployment) workloads .  Nvidia's stock price has been quite volatile in 2025, falling nearly 35% from its high in early January to its recent low in April . The surge in share price was driven by the company's strategic partnership with Saudi Arabia, which will provide several hundred thousand of its advanced GPUs over the next five years .  The U.S. government has revoked the Biden-era AI diffusion rule, which would have restricted chip exports to 120 countries, starting May 15, 2025 . Amazon Web Services (AWS) is indisputably a significant growth catalyst for Amazon .  Amazon's AI initiatives are also helping build new revenue streams . The company's AI business has already reached a "multibillion dollar annual revenue run rate" Amazon is focused on developing a complete AI stack, including custom chips, foundational models, and AI applications .  Amazon's retail operations are benefiting from a rearchitected inbound network, driving better inventory placement, higher units per package, and lower delivery costs . The company is also working on other initiatives, such as expanding its same-day delivery sites and rural delivery network .  Kuiper positions Amazon to capture a substantial share of the satellite internet market estimated to be worth $108 billion by 2035 . Despite its strong fundamentals and multiple tailwinds, Amazon trades at approximately 28.6 times forward earnings, which is well below the five-year average .
